narratives.description:
Many businesses have multiple groups handling the different facets of business technology. Generally, an information technology (IT) operations manager oversees these multiple groups. They may supervise only a few or a large number of employees, depending on the size of the business. They must work closely with others and mentor subordinates when necessary. 
The IT operations manager must have leadership experience and excellent communication skills. Typically a bachelor's degree and several years' experience in a related field are required, although many times experience can substitute for education or knowledge of a specific department or industry. Experience with a variety of operation systems such as Unix, Linux and Windows is highly desired, as is programming knowledge. General understanding of current technology is also helpful.
narratives.summaryHourly: The average pay for an Information Technology (IT) Operations Manager is $30.00 per hour.
narratives.summarySalary: The average pay for an Information Technology (IT) Operations Manager is $98,887 per year.

occupationalDetails.skills: Operations Management, Information Technology (IT) Support, Leadership, IT Management, Project Management, IT Security & Infrastructure, Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL), Windows Operating System General Use, Cisco Networking, Microsoft Exchange, Network Management / Administration, System Administration, Microsoft SQL Server, People Management, Windows NT / 2000 / XP Networking, Internet Information Server (IIS), Windows 2003 Server, Microsoft Office, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Budget Management, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Microsoft Active Directory, VMware ESX, Product Management, Strategic Project Management, Risk Management / Risk Control, Software Development, Policy Development, Linux, Network Security Management, Cyber Security, Microsoft Excel, Windows Server 2012 R2, Systems Help Desk Management, Program Management
